headline: Calico Beans
description: Calico beans like kidney, lima, and butter slow-cook with browned ground beef and bacon in sweet and tangy sauce for a crowd-pleasing one-dish meal.
name: Calico Beans

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cook ground beef and bacon in a large, deep skillet over medium-high heat until evenly brown. Drain and transfer meat to a 4-quart casserole dish.
Add pork and beans, kidney beans, butter beans, lima beans, brown sugar, onion, celery, ketchup, vinegar, and dry mustard to the casserole dish; mix well.
Bake, covered, in the preheated oven until bubbly and heated through, about 1 hour.

review.reviewBody: Nice, easy basic recipe. I use this as a "base" that I doctor up to suit our tastes. I agree that is a lot of brown sugar, but I tend to add molasses so I use less sugar anyway. I omit celery, and I add a bit of minced garlic and a few dashes of chili powder.
Excellent recipe! Since I halved it, I only used the two cans of pork and beans. I also left out the celery (which I don't care for) and prepared this on the stove top.

This is my new go-to calico beans recipe. Tweaked it a bit based on other reviews. Used BBQ sauce vs. catsup, reduced brown sugar in half, used apple cider vinegar vs. white wine vinegar. Browned the celery with the hamburger and onions as many reviewers didn't like the uncooked celery taste/texture. This casserole is heading to a neighborhood picnic with the bacon crumbled on top of it today. We sampled it and it's delicious!

I have loved Calico Beans since childhood, but as a few others said this was WAY too sweet. Ketchup has sugar as well, so adding a cup of brown is overload for me. I will make again with less sugar for sure! Thanks for sharing!
Great dish
Delicious family loved this great for get together
One of our favorites! Everyone seems to like it.

This is a recipe that is very similar to what i grew up with. I agree with the others the 1 cup of brown sugar might be a little too sweet unless you have a sweet tooth. I halved it and then tasted the mixture before I but it in the oven and it was the right sweetness. Also I tend to fry the ground beef and the bacon separately.
Made exactly as noted except cooked in the crock pot on low for 5 hours. This was a very filling, delicious dish.

In the ingredients was listed 1 c brown sugar, however it was not mentioned in the directions so I just added it with other ingredients. WAY TOO SWEET!!!
I will try this again with MAYBE 1/4 of that. I love the variety of beans, and would add a few of my favorites as well.

This is so easy and delicious. Giving 4 stars only because the amount of sugar called for is way too much. After reading other reviews I used a little more than 1/4 cup and will still probably cut back to just 1/4 cup.

The sugar absolutely ruined this dish. I even added green beans to the already lima, butter beans, kidney, and small pink beans as I didn’t have the pork and beans. 1lb and a half of ground beef. Amazed anyone can get behind these with all that sugar. Do yourself a favor and cut at least in half. They will still be very sweet

Definitely used half of the brown sugar. Also doubled recipe to include many different beans. Drained all beans except the pork n beans, then added half back into the final dish before baking. Excellent recipe!
This is a must at every summer bbq!!! I leave out the Lima’s and replace with xtra can of white or brown beans (butter beans,kidney, pinto) whatever i have on hand.

I read the reviews before I made this so I decreased the brown sugar to 2/3 cup . I thought it was still too sweet. I used bacon bits instead of cooked bacon. Everything else went as per recipe. My husband loved it so I will definitely make this again.
Super easy!!! & YUMMY!
I loved it!! Plan on making it again
Add chorizo with the ground beef
Used 1/2 cup water because I like to drain beans

This was SO SO SO yummy. I sautéed the onions and boiled the celery to make it soft (that’s the only way my kids will eat it). And i used 3/4 cup of dark brown sugar and about 1/3 cup of ketchup so it would be just a little bit less sweet. Those are the only changes I made. It came out sooooo good. Served it with some yellow cornbread
Have made numerous times. Very good.

I've been making this recipe for years, and was glad to find it here on All Recipes. It has a wonderful sweet/savory blend of flavors that's just fantastic. My entire family loves it.
I do make it with a couple of tweaks. Typically, I also add a can of drained green beans and a can of drained wax beans. Really, any type of beans will work in this casserole! I also use just regular white vinegar, and often substitute prepared mustard for the mustard powder.
A really hearty, fiber-filled dinner option!

I make this every time we have our annual Women’s weekend. All the ladies love it and this year it was requested by my niece, she wanted to be sure I wasn’t making anything else. It is well loved and eaten by all. It’s absolutely the easiest and tastiest bean recipe I’ve every tried. Nutritionally, beans are very high in protein so, have at it everyone!

I made these as a replacement for Boston style baked beans to accompany BBQ Ribs. Just wanted something different, these fit the bill perfectly. I deleted the ground beef and added a can of great northern beans I had on hand, I made no other changes. These were a big hit with everyone at the gathering. They were a little soupier after baking the first hour covered than I really wanted them to be so I baked them another 30 minutes uncovered and the consistency was perfect. We all love all kinds of beans so next time I may add more kinds of beans, but that will be the only changes I make, these will be added to the rotation as a Casserole with the ground beef but also as a substitute for other baked beans. Very versatile recipe, loved it.
I couldn’t get Lima beans (didn’t think to use frozen), so I used a can of garbanzo beans. Very good!
This is always a big hit at parties.

I found this waaaaay too sweet for my taste. I would definitely cut the brown sugar back to 1/3 or even 1/4 cup, add more vinegar and swap 1/2 of the ketchup for tomato sauce. Worth making again for sure and it is easy to tweak it to your personal taste.

I made this two different ways...one regular and one veg. I used large butter, black bean with jalapeno and lime, vegetarian baked beans and cannellini all undrained mixed in a bowl. One pot had 3 strips bacon that had been browned then removed, then added beef, onion and celery including tops! The other pot I heated EVOO and added the onion and celery …. browned everything in each pot....followed by half the bean mixture to each. I used BBQ for the veg version ( wishing I had liquid smoke )and half BBQ and ketchup for the other, red wine vinegar because it was low and I'm trying to use it up and mustard powder. ( I added a little extra ketchup and mustard powder to the meat version because the man is a fan of both). Also, chopped the cooked bacon and threw it in the meat pot. I did not add any sugar because I was making sweet cornbread....I simmered on the stove covered for ease of preparation. This is fantastic!! Thank you Kathy!!!!
A full pound of bacon never hurt anyone.

This recipe is yummy and preferable compared to other Calico Bean recipes. The Lima beans contrast nicely against the sauce and kidney beans. I reduced the sugar to half a cup. The white wine vinegar adds a unique tartness to the dish. Can be used as a main dish and goes nicely with raw vegetables or a green salad.

It was tasty, the flavor is good. I made it for 25 servings, Thank you allrecipes , I appreciate the serving conversion and shopping list. the presentation is true to photos posted. leftovers are great. this one is a keeper!
Very Good!!
Did not change a thing about this recipe. Family loved it! Will definitely make this again and again.
I made it in one cast iron pot. Cooked hamburger and bacon; drained, then added other ingredients. A little sweat. Next time I might use only 1/2 cup brown sugar.
Made similar recipe in the past, but this was delicious! I added a half of a chopped green pepper...love it and will definitely make again the same way.
I have made these several times for family and work. They are so good it is hard to limit yourself to just one helping.

I have made this since I was a very young woman. I use whatever cans of beans I have on hand. Usually, pork & beans, kidney beans & chili beans unless I see something at market that looks interesting. I use way less brown sugar about a TBLSP. I use a tsp or two of vinegar & the rest the same. Perfect on cold winter nights with corn bread & fried potatoes.
Fantastic! Followed recipe as written, except cut back on sugar. Baked in oven in old enameled roasting pan. Looked exactly like Kathy- submitter's photo! Yummy.

I was about to give this a "menh" rating, because it was so flat tasting. Then I realized our cans of beans are 19oz, not 15oz. Extra beans need extra sauce. Bumped up everything in the sauce by another half recipe. Added 1/2 cup smoky Bbq sauce instead of more ketchup, and 1/4 cup of maple syrup instead of brown sugar (3/4 cup brown sugar used). Used prepared mustard instead of dry mustard (2tbsp). Added 1/2 cup of red peppers. Very happy with the results! Next time I'll use one less can of beans, so I won't have to tinker with the sauce so much.
I use White Northern Beans instead of butter beans, and leave out the celery, so amazing & always a big hit!! I would never eat Lima beans other than in this recipe, it's yummy!!
Delicious!! The best calico beans I've ever made. I add extra garlic to it. And I love using the chili beans with chili sauce. I'll never make another recipe. It's a keeper!!
just like I remember!

This recipe was so easy to make and soooo good. I took it to a family potluck and it received great reviews. I'll be making this one again. I followed the recipe and did not make any adjustments, there was no need.
Super tasty. I followed the other recommendations to decrease the sugar to 1/2 cup and I'm very glad I did.

The end result tastes good. If I make it again, I would cut the bacon into smaller pieces that what I did this time. The hamburger cooked faster than the bacon. I did not think this recipe was too sweet.
Followed the recipe exactly and it was perfect. Definitely making it again.
This has become one of my go to recipes and we all find it delicious. I follow the recipe to the T. Occasionally I cut the amount brown sugar. I hope you like it as much as we do.
I made this with two changes based on other reviews. I decreased the brown sugar to 1/2 cup and omitted the lima beans. We liked it, just not sure what to serve with it.
I don't think I know anyone who doesn't like this. It's our favorite dish to have with burgers. It's even great in day two or three if there's any left.
This was a good basic bean recipe. It needed some zip to make it special.

Holy cow!! This was way too sweet!!! I've made this twice now: first time as per the recipe, and the second time, I cut the sugar to half a cup and it was still really sweet. Will make again, but next time, the sugar is getting cut to a 1/4 cup.

I like to cook the bacon separately so it is crisp and then crumble it into the recipe. I always use garbanzo beans and either baby butter or baby lima beans (if I can find them). I have used white kidney beans and or navy beans in a pinch . I like the light red kidneys better than the dark. Be sure to add the vinegar so the beans break down a little & flavors mix. Always a big hit and my husband requests them often.

As other reviewers have said before me, you can mix any beans & achieve a great dish. I didn't have all the beans listed - I used northern beans, pinto beans, a can of mixed beans & baked beans. I also replaced ketchup with tomato sauce & some sausage for the bacon. I cooked it all in a crock pot. The recipe is not something I would ever have tried but it popped up when I was looking for something else. I read quite a few of the reviews and decided to go with what I had to make it as close to the recipe as possible. Really glad I did. I'll be making it again with all the ingredients as listed. Thanks to the poster.

Far too sweet. I doubled everything in this recipe except I reduced the brown sugar to 11/2 cups instead of the 2 cups it should have had. I suggest 1/2 cup brown sugar for a single recipe - other than sweetness it was good.

Turned out great but I made a few changes...I switched up the beans and used only 3 cans...black beans, cannelloni and pinto. I substituted rice wine vinegar for the white wine vinegar, used regular mustard instead of mustard powder and eliminated the celery completely. It turned out perfectly, not watery but just right. I served it with a loaf of freshly baked bread and the family loved it. Economy wise it was also fairly cheap, I only used 1/2 pkg bacon and everything else I had on hand! Great potluck recipe too!

Better with chili sauce as opposed to ketchup and use less sugar. Omitted celery and added 1 C. chopped onion. Cooked bacon then cooked onion in bacon fat. Also, there is so much liquid from the beans that I baked it uncovered.

This is close to a recipe used by my mother years ago. I was happy to find it because she never wrote hers down.
This is a VERY good recipe as-is, however the next time I make it I will cut back on the brown sugar by about half and add some sort of hot sauce. I used Sriracha on it after my first taste and enjoyed the kick it gave it, but that may be too hot or garlicy for some. You would have to be careful not to 'over sauce' this however as there was still quite a bit of liquid (soupy) when done. Maybe cut the ketchup in half and replace with Franks or Sriracha and cook the last 10 or 15 mins uncovered on lowest oven rack.
Regardless, even if you make it as the recipe calls for, it's excellent and my entire family asked why I had never made it before. They loved it.

I'd give it a four & a half if I could. Tasty and easy, but definitely too much brown sugar. I exchanged the large butter beans for black beans, which I think was a good move. I will for sure make again with a few adjustments.
Loved it!! Just like what mom use to make. I did add couple shakes of worchestire sauce and Steak sauce. Just for tang.
I love this recipe... full flavor and easy... I usually don't use the ground beef. I love to put extra bacon. I cook the bacon out very crispy so as not to add the fat, just the flavor.

This is a great recipe for calico beans. I did use pinto beans instead of lima and butter beans. I decreased the brown sugar to one half cup and that was perfect for our taste. I baked these at 325 degrees for almost two hours. They are always even better the next day. Great recipe Kathy. Thank you.

I don't use the hamburger only a pound of bacon and once I'm done frying the bacon I pour off some of the grease and add all the other ingredients to the pan . The grease gives it a little extra flavor. I also add a little extra brown sugar. I have people requesting my beans for parties all the time. I think the hamburger gives it a weird texture and flavor! Try it this way u might like it!!
We make this with pork for our Christmas lunch/dinner each year. It's a great recipe if you leave out the brown sugar and celery, especially if you are not partial to sweet beans.
Pretty good, great for a cold day and not too sweet. The butter beans seem a little off for this recipe but it isn't bad. My family loves it!
Great, I would just reduce the brown sugar.

I've made this several times. Always a little different depending on what is in my kitchen. This time I substituted ham for bacon and added a healthy teaspoon of liquid smoke. I cook it covered on top of the stove on low heat for an hour and let it sit overnight. Yum!
Yummy and easy!!

Wow! WAY TOO SWEET!!! 1. I needed to stretch this recipe so I added 2 more cans of beans. 2. Based on other reviews, I halved the brown sugar. Even with the extra beans 1/2 C brown sugar was too much. 3. 1/2 C ketchup also seems to be too much. Too ketchupy. 4. As far as I can tell, Lima beans and butter beans are the same thing (ingredients list on the back of can of butter beans says "Lima beans"!). This was particularly confusing as the recipe wants me to drain the Lima beans, but not the butter beans!!! :-)
I just made this and it is very very sweet. I recommend you start with a 1/3 cup of brown sugar (and if you need more, add sugar sparingly).

I LOVE this recipe! I must have made this 100 times by now (don't know why I didn't rate this sooner) and each time I make it I get compliments and requests for the recipe. About 2 years ago, my hubby went vegetarian so now I make this without the meat and bacon and it still is a huge hit! It's nice to make and bring something that both vegetarians and others can both enjoy! I make this at least once every 2 weeks for him in his recipe rotation and he (we) never tire of it. Try this recipe! Oh, and I use whatever beans I have on hand - as long as you use the pork and beans (or baked beans) the rest of the beans can be any combination and it always tastes great!

This was a big hit at our family reunion yesterday. I doubled the recipe and after browning the burger and onions together, I combined it all in the crock pot, set it on high for 2 hours to get it going, then set on low the next 2 hrs. It was perfect in time for the reunion, and I had 3 people ask me for the recipe. The only thing I left out was the celery because I'm not a big fan of it. My 3 guys were a bit disappointed there weren't any leftovers to take home! I will make this as a main dish at home again because its tasty, very filling and especially very economical!
This recipe is fantastic. I followed the directions exactly and make this for many occasions since it is always requested for get togethers.

I made these when I needed to get something in the crockpot quick. I used a ring of polska kielbasa instead of burger and bacon. Only used a can of baked beans and the lima and butter beans. Added no brown sugar at all, not needed, and just a squirt of ketchup. This was good and I will make again in a foil pan to throw on the bbq when camping.

This recipe is so good! I make it without the lima beans (I hate them) and celery (my husband hates it) and substitute apple cider vinegar for regular vinegar because that is all I buy. I make this for dinner at least every few weeks and serve with cornbread and take it to potlucks. I always get requests for the recipe. Even people that don't like beans like this.

Good overall, but overly sweet for our tastes... Even with the use of the recommendations to halve the brown sugar and use tomato sauce instead of ketchup. I found myself adding chilie powder to give it some other flavor but SWEET, but it was still just OK.
Fantastic. I don't use any onions, and I've used different beans, and it is always good!

Due to popular demand, I make these beans for both Easter (they go great with ham, deviled eggs, and potato salad) and my family reunion every year. The only thing I do differently is cut the brown sugar by about half. Great recipe!
brought to pot luck and brought none home
Took this to a July 4th potluck. Very good! I did not have lima beans so used black bean instead. I will make this again.

Great basic recipe. I agree with others that you only need to use half the amount of sugar. Very easy to play around with by changing the types of beans and meat. I used seasoned sausage, white vinegar and added in some extra baked beans and chili beans to fill a crock pot for a family reunion. Turned out great.
Addicting! We reduced the sugar and added a bit more smoke flavor and upped the vinegar just a bit for more zing. Get's rave reviews every time.

A budget-friendly family favorite. However, I do make it a wee bit more economical by starting with dry beans, and cooking them in water with a ham bone from our last ham dinner. Once the beans are cooked, I remove the bone and let it cool. In the mean time, I place the beans in my crock pot with all of the standard ingredients, sometimes going lighter on the ground beef and bacon. Once the ham bone cools, I remove any usable meat from the bone and put it in with the beans. Let it cook for several hours on low. The dry beans don't have the additives that canned beans have, so its a bit healthier, and I usually get enough tasty meat from a ham bone that the family doesn't notice that I used less bacon and hamburger. A win for everyone.

Really great basic recipe you tweak to your liking. I usually omit the butter beans (hate them) and double up on the kidney beans. It's a bit sweet made as written so I also cut back on the sugar. Really good if you add some garlic powder and a bit of paprika too. My 22 month old loves it with steamed rice. Thanks, Kathy!
This was good. I had to use red wine vinegar as that is all I had. Thanks!
I give this 5 stars because it's a quick dish for parties and everyone likes it. It's full of fiber fiber fiber.

Excellent, but far too sweet for our tastes. No big deal though, I just cut the sugar in half and it was so good. You can throw any beans you want in and it's always good. Family wants this at all the BBQ's. Thanks Kathy

This was very good! I made several changes so I know it's hardly fair to rate it but here goes... I used one can of chili beans, one can of kidney beans, one can of black beans and one can of great northern beans. I sauteed the onion with the ground beef. I let the meat cook a little before I added the onion so I wouldn't need to add any oil for the onion. I only used 3/4 cup of sugar and eliminated the bacon. I'm sure the bacon would have put it over-the-top amazing, but I didn't want to bother to defrost a whole package from my freezer to use a little here. I will be making this again. Very tasty!!

Years ago I worked with a really good friend and for every potluck she brought these beans. I loved them so much it was usually all I ate at the potluck. As written this recipe is the bomb so meat eaters try it, you will love it. Since then i have become a vegetarian. So is my son and kinda picky so here is what i did to tweak it for us. No ground beef, used 1 cup tvp. No pork in beans, just veggie baked beans. No ketchup (my son hates it), so drained a can of diced tomatoes, pured and used 1/2 cup of that. No bacon and for the smoky flavor I used 4 chilpolte peppers in adobo sauce, pured. My son also hates mustard of any kind so for that mustard tang i used1 small can of diced green chilis. I also used apple cider vinegar because I love it better than white. Everything else was the same as the original recipe. Yes, that was major tweaking on this otherwise awesome recipe but WOW! It came out very very yummy. For you veggie peoples give this tweaked version a try :-)
use only 1/2 cup of brown sugar, decrease vinegar to 2 tbs, skip celery

I make this for all our family gatherings by request and my family loves it. I mix the beans up sometimes when I can't find the exact beans it calls for. I have noticed that brand name pork and beans lend a better flavor than the generic ones.

The absolute easiest base recipe. I have cooked as written (which is great, although a bit sweet for our taste) and also changed everything from the amounts, the type of meat, how its cooked and the kind of beans and I've always had it turn out great. (Always use baked beans, though.) Some suggestions for alternates: use shredded roast in place of hamburger, use full cup of brwn sugar but exchange tomato sauce for ketchup, use sausage and 1 lb bacon. You really can change this recipe to totally suit your family's taste or to make it a sidedish instead of the main dish. Also, it freezes well: put leftovers in ziplock baggie to freeze- pop in microwave or heat on stovetop for quick meal. THANK YOU!!!!!
The best baked beans we've ever had. Took them to a party last night and got rave reviews. Instead of baking, i made them early and put them in a crockpot for 6 hours.

Great! I omitted the celery and pork and beans, and used cans of kidney, lima, pinto and black-eyed peas. I also added a little more bacon, and some of our favorite Rudy's BBQ sauce, great for BBQ get togethers!

Really, really good! Made exactly as stated...I thought it odd at first that this could be something that you could bring to Thanksgiving, a cookout or a pot luck....but it really is just that kind of a dish! My son said it was the "bestest" meal I ever made!

My boys loved it. I followed the review's and cut down the brown sugar by 1/2. I also added some barbecue sauce. I have kids that wont eat onions so I used onion powder. We dont like lima beans so I did 2 pork and beans. I did brown the bacon first and then the beef. It is very good. We will make it again.

My sister inlaw said i should try making these. I've never had them before. I must say i loved them!!! Gonna make more for my family today. They didn't last long and i didn't get my fill of them. Very good recipe and ty for sharing.
Delicios when served with buttermilk cornbread from this site.
Awesome! My husband swears this tastes just like his grandmother's cherished family recipe. I have also made this with a mixed variety of beans, always with success.

For this recipe there is never a spoonful left. I have used different combinations of beans, usually what I have on hand and it always seems to come out great. This has never failed as a passing dish.
